CHAT.comment: MOT and Chi discuss Chi's favorite part of Eric Carle's book. Mot helps Chi spell a few words (but declines to help spell sincerely) , comments on his punctuation , and discusses topics to include in the letter. In a conversation with INV she says the study has become a fun staple of their life even though their only meets with INV once or twice a year. Despite lots_of extra conversation , which Chi participates in , he writes the letter independently and well (but gives Mot due credit as a collaborator). Mot uses sophisticated vocabulary (traumatized , remission; talking about a cat , mind you) in conversation with INV. Mot and Chi seem to have a very warm relationship. Letter is in cursive.

u.a: MOT and INV chat , including discussion of Chi's nice cursive hand+writing . INV askes if they are doing Denilian [?] method , MOT doesn't know .
MOT comments about her own hand+writing
referring to hand+writing instruction at school ?
impressed
mouthing out words as he writes ?
describes Chi writing books in school last year; Chi wrote a book about how Mot was depressed about turning 30
Chi chimes in about book he wrote last year , then suddenly reads what he'd written
whispering to Mot
reacting to INV's revelation
talks to INV about her age
MOT comments about the video camera (for magnet task)
MOT tells INV about a student presentation day . Chi joins in . Chi asks Mot the meaning of a word she uses (dainty); Mot's definition is only appropriate for the context she used . oh well !
perhaps commenting about spacing in word love
mumbles
slightly sing-song
saying to spell your as <you're>
embarrassed
erases period ?
bef writes v on another piece of paper ?
MOT and INV talk about the pets . Chi joins in and tells the INV a story about the pet .
MOT and INV (with occasional comments from Chi) continue talking pet stuff
flips through book with mom
mom is unsure of the o when spelling favorite
whispered

aft whispering contintues
discussion of camcorder batteries (Chi is the expert) , then quiet as Chi gets back to work , then Mot comments on how many side conversations the transcriber will have to listen to !
cat
Chi whispers the word junk to himself as he continues to work on the letter
MOT tells INV about a school project Chi did last year . Chi invented a device one wears to sleep; it keeps out noise
makes suggestion to Chi about inventions

INV and Mot whisper to each other while Chi writes; at 21:10 Mot says that even though the study doesn't take much of their time , they still think of it as a fun part of their lives . INV says there will be some weaning time . Chi asks what weening time is , and Mot replies by asking him about his progress on the letter
